title: British Official Stresses Threat From China Even Amid Russian Aggression
description: The head of Britain’s GCHQ spy agency warned that the West should not lose sight of the technological challenge from China as it deals with the immediate problem of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Putin Unleashes Barrage of Missiles on Ukrainian Civilian Areas
description: The Russian president tied the attack to a bombing of the bridge to Crimea, and vowed that more strikes would follow if Russian targets were hit again.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Russia’s Retaliatory Strikes on Ukraine
description: Plus North Korea’s underwater missile silos and trouble in the Metaverse.

title: With Attacks on Ukraine, Putin Gives Hard-Liners What They Wanted
description: A sharp shift toward deadly strikes signaled that domestic pressure over Russia’s flailing war effort had escalated to the point where Vladimir Putin felt a decisive show of force was necessary.

title: Russian Strikes Batter Kyiv and Send Residents Dashing for Cover
description: The fighting in Ukraine had felt far from the capital in recent months, but the barrage of missiles brought many residents back to the fear and uncertainty of the early days of Russia’s invasion.

title: Airbus and Air France Go on Trial Over 2009 Rio-Paris Crash
description: Families of the 228 victims fought for years to bring the companies to court. Both face manslaughter charges.

title: Biden Condemns Russia’s Missile Strikes on Ukraine
description: The president reaffirmed U.S. support for Ukraine, but did not announce any new steps in response to Russia’s missile strikes.

title: Lukashenko Says Russian Troops Will Return to Belarus in Large Numbers
description: Statements by President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, an eccentric and highly erratic dictator, are rarely an accurate guide to current or future events.

title: Striking Defense Lawyers in U.K. Agree to Return to Work
description: The government will increase legal aid fees by 15 percent for new and existing cases, ending a weekslong walkout.

title: Black Holes May Hide a Mind-Bending Secret About Our Universe
description: Take gravity, add quantum mechanics, stir. What do you get? Just maybe, a holographic cosmos.

title: Live Updates: Putin Says ‘Mass Strike’ on Ukraine Is Revenge for Bridge Attack
description: After missiles hit at least 10 Ukrainian cities, President Vladimir V. Putin warned in a televised address that “no one should have any doubt” that Russia will defend itself.

title: India and China Call for De-Escalation After Russian Strikes
description: Two key trading partners of Russia renewed calls for an end to the fighting, though they again did not directly criticize Moscow’s war.

title: Attacks on Ukraine’s Cities Come Days After Crimean Bridge Explosion
description: Ukrainians had been bracing for a severe Russian response after the main bridge linking Russia to Crimea was damaged over the weekend.

title: Pro-Russian Figures Celebrate Ukraine Strikes as Revenge for Crimea Bridge
description: While many pro-Russian commentators have advocated a much tougher approach to the war, their calls grew louder as Russia suffered setbacks in recent weeks.

title: U.K.’s Young Hobbled by Inflation
description: Sharp price spikes are forcing the country’s young to move back in with family and worry about finances just as many were hoping to move past the pandemic.

title: U.K.’s Young Hobbled by Inflation
description: Sharp price spikes are forcing the country’s young to move back in with family and worry about finances just as many were hoping to move past the pandemic.

title: Russians React to Attacks in Ukraine
description: Some younger Russians expressed sadness about the missile strikes in civilian areas, but were not ready to put the blame squarely on the Kremlin.

title: ‘They’re inhuman’: In Kyiv, the strikes shattered a couple’s morning coffee routine.
description: Yuri and Irina Penza said that they believed Monday’s attacks were revenge for Ukraine’s bombing of the sole bridge linking Russia to Crimea.

title: In Southern Ukraine, Signs of Low Russian Morale Amid Retreat
description: The Ukrainians are making gains in the south, an area where Russian soldiers are dug in more securely and where their retreat has been less chaotic than in the north.

title: Ukraine says the strikes aimed to cripple its energy system as winter nears.
description: A senior official said it was “unequivocally clear” that Russian strikes had targeted energy facilities in 12 regions across the country.

title: In Face of Drought, the Netherlands Reserves Course to Save Water
description: As climate change dries out Europe, the Netherlands, a country long shaped by its overabundance of water, is suddenly confronting drought.

title: North Korea Says It Is Building Underwater Nuclear Weapons Silos
description: The country’s leader, Kim Jong-un, has inspected a recent flurry of missile tests, vowing to increase — and never give up — his nuclear weapons.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Repercussions from an attack on the bridge between Crimea and Russia.

title: What We Know About Putin’s Nuclear Threats in Ukraine War
description: Comments from President Biden last week raised the issue for the first time in decades.

title: Landslides Leave at Least 22 Dead, and Dozens Missing in Venezuela
description: The Venezuelan armed forces planned to deploy canines and drones to find missing residents and to deliver food and medicine.
